It is impossible to gauge, even approximately, the percentage of foreigners in Rome. Although based on the census of 1527, it may be estimated that 68 per cent of the city’s inhabitants were Romans, 7.3 per cent non-Italians, and the rest foreigners from other parts of Italy.
